fullText: The revival of She Loves Me at Studio 54 is so charming, so beautifully performed, and so perfectly scaled to its intimate venue that it seems to have been waiting 52 years for exactly this production.
dtliExcerpt: The revival of She Loves Me at Studio 54 is so charming, so beautifully performed, and so perfectly scaled to its intimate venue that it seems to have been waiting 52 years for exactly this production.
bwwExcerpt: When a production has enough outstanding elements working in its favor -- as the Roundabout's revival of She Loves Me starring Laura Benanti and Zachary Levi certainly does -- your mind can fill in the rest, and more. Benanti, with her thrilling voice and zany self-deprecation, is perfect casting for Amalia Balash...Their lyrics, by Sheldon Harnick, marry gentle wit to character development with the highest technical polish; his rhymes get laughs not because they're tricky but because they're so apt...These nearly prose observations miraculously sit on music, by Jerry Bock, that maintains their contours while flowering into arias of enormous beauty, especially for Amalia, who has a heavy stack of them to sell. This is where Benanti's gifts become crucial. She is, no surprise, a joy to listen to -- even when, as last night, recovering from bronchitis. But she brings to the job of making beautiful sounds the natural comic's instinct of opening herself to heartbreak.

llmScore.reasoning: [ensemble-majority] | 2/3 models agree: Rave | Claude: Effusive praise with superlative language ('so charming', 'so beautifully performed', 'so perfectly scaled') and the romantic notion that this is the production the show has been waiting decades for indicates unqualified enthusiasm. | Gemini: The review is overwhelmingly positive, using words like "charming" and "beautifully performed." The critic suggests this production is ideal, indicating a strong recommendation. | Kimi: Unreserved praise for the revival's charm, performances, and staging, with the critic declaring this is the definitive production the show has been waiting 52 years to receive.
